meanings.definition: Having all sides or faces equal in length.
meanings.sent1: The equilateral triangle had three sides of the same length.
meanings.sent2: The children colored in an equilateral shape during art class.
meanings.sent3: The equilateral cookie was perfectly round and evenly baked.
meanings.sent4: Her equilateral thinking led to balanced decisions in the project.
meanings.sent5: The equilateral fence created a sense of symmetry in the garden.

meanings.definition: A figure or shape with all sides or faces equal in length.
meanings.sent1: The playground had a colorful equilateral on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The equilateral of the building made it stand out in the cityscape.
meanings.sent3: The equilateral in the puzzle completed the picture perfectly.
meanings.sent4: His equilateral of the situation helped him see things clearly.
meanings.sent5: The equilateral of the diamond sparkled in the sunlight.
